snippet: Japan’s two largest airlines said they would ground their fleets of Boeing’s new 787 aircraft after one operated by All Nippon Airways made an emergency landing in western Japan.
abstract: Japan’s two largest airlines, Japan Airlines and All Nippon Airways, say they plan to ground their fleets of Boeing’s 787 aircraft after one operated by All Nippon made emergency landing in western Japan; emergency landing is latest in string of problems with the aircraft, including battery fire, fuel leaks, and cracked cockpit window.

byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and JAD MOUAWAD

lead_paragraph: Japan’s two largest airlines said they would ground their fleets of Boeing’s new 787 aircraft after one operated by All Nippon Airways made an emergency landing in western Japan.

headline.seo: Boeing 787s Are Grounded by Japanese Airlines
headline.main: Top Airlines in Japan Grounding Boeing 787s
headline.print_headline: Top Airlines In Japan Grounding Boeing 787s
